headline: Boeing’s Earnings Showed Progress. Wall Street Targets Are Highest Since 2023.
summary: Boeing’s  second-quarter earnings report wasn’t perfect, but it showed progress.  Wall Street had expected a loss of $1.40 on sales of $21.7 billion, according to Bloomberg.  Coming into earnings, Boeing stock was very strong, up 30% over the preceding three months.

headline: Wolfe lifts Boeing PT saying stock drop post Q2 overlooks cash flow improvement
summary: Investing.com --Wolfe Research stuck to its Outperform rating on Boeing (NYSE:BA) while bumping its price target by $10 to $250, saying the 4% decline in shares after its second-quarter results appears out of step with improvement in the company’s full-year free cash flow outlook.

headline: Airbus faces engine delays but reaffirms jet delivery targets
summary: PARIS (Reuters) -European planemaker Airbus on Wednesday revealed a growing queue of aircraft waiting for engines before they can be delivered to airlines, but reaffirmed its delivery goals for the year after securing promises over supplies from engine makers.  "It won't be a walk in the park; it will be more back-loaded than we would like," CEO Guillaume Faury told analysts, adding that engine makers had agreed to support the delivery target.  Airbus has faced fluctuating supplies from its largest  supplier CFM International, co-owned by GE Aerospace and Safran, but delays have spread to its RTX-owned  rival Pratt & Whitney in the wake of a recent strike, Airbus said.

raw.headline: Airbus faces engine delays but reaffirms jet delivery targets

Airbus has faced fluctuating supplies from its largest  supplier CFM International, co-owned by GE Aerospace and Safran, but delays have spread to its RTX-owned  rival Pratt & Whitney in the wake of a recent strike, Airbus said.

headline: Itasca MGA Provides Aircraft Finance Insurance Cover to Allegiant Air
summary: Itasca MGA Limited ("Itasca MGA"), an aviation-focused managing general agent created by alternative investment manager Castlelake and Pine Walk Capital, a wholly owned subsidiary of The Fidelis Partnership, today announced it has structured a new insurance policy that supports an aircraft debt facility for Allegiant Air, LLC ("Allegiant") to finance the delivery of new 737 MAX 8-200 aircraft.

headline: Japan's Panasonic announces a new chief at its group company as its profits barely hold up
summary: Japanese electronics and technology company Panasonic has chosen a new chief executive at a group company after eking out a 1.2% rise in its first-quarter profit.  Kenneth William Sain, a former Boeing executive, will replace Yasuyuki Higuchi as Panasonic Connect's president and chief executive in April 2026, the company said Wednesday.  Panasonic Connect offers solutions and products for various supply chains, public services, infrastructure and entertainment sectors.
